page.title: 18Southend:Local interest
page.content: In Southend there are several features which are generally interesting for the public.One of these is{Southchurch Hall}which was built in the early 14th century and extended in the mid-sixteenth century. It is now a popular{museum}set in attractive gardens with many birds and ducks in the pond there. Another of these features is {Mulberry Harbour}in the Thames Estuary.This is part of the large harbour constructed by the allies in the Second World War for the invasion of Europe in 1944.It was constructed along the estuary and towed to Arromanches in France.One part of it sunk and now is a common sight from the seafront area from where it can be seen at high or low tide.
